The expert fact: checked the claim made by Philip Van Cleave, president of the Virginia Citizens Defense League, regarding the percentage of criminals who go through background checks when obtaining guns.
The expert examined a 2016 survey conduc: S. Bureau of Justice Statistics, which involved 24,848 state and federal prisoners.
The survey revealed that 21: of the inmates used or possessed a firearm during the crime that led to their imprisonment.
Among the prisoners who bought their gun: approximately 67% underwent a background check using their real names.
